page.title: 01GENERAL SUMMARY-GOYTRE AREA
page.content: The south-west corner of the area in question is{03320204}on the O.S. sheet{SO 30}of Usk.The main features are the{River Usk}and the{Newport}to {Abergavenny}railway line,which both run from north to south.Also important is the village of{Goytre,}which has expanded with domestic dwellings since the publication of the O.S.map. The land is fairly level rising from{75 feet}above sea level,the level at which the Usk flows,to a maximum of {380 feet}near{Ty Mawr}farm.The area is mainly {grassland}with areas of deciduous and mixed woodland.The land is occupied mainly by farmland, which is mostly grazing, with some arable. {Nant y Robwl}and other streams flow into the Usk and the area is dotted with wells and springs.The{A4042 {Pontypool-Abergavenny}trunkroad runs north/south, in the south-west corner.
